update.description:
A model may have several versions, which are numbered starting from 1 and `tip` refers to the latest available version.

The new local cache structure is the following:

~~~
/home/louise/.ignition/fuel/
├── config.yaml
└── localhost:8000
    └── chapulina
        └── models
            └── Custom drill
                ├── 1
                │   ├── materials
                │   │   └── textures
                │   │       └── cordless_drill.png
                │   ├── meshes
                │   │   ├── cordless_drill.dae
                │   │   └── cordless_drill.stl
                │   ├── model.config
                │   └── model.sdf
                ├── 2
                │   ├── materials
                │   │   └── textures
                │   │       └── cordless_drill.png
                │   ├── meshes
                │   │   ├── cordless_drill.dae
                │   │   └── cordless_drill.stl
                │   ├── model.config
                │   └── model.sdf
                └── (no more tip symlink!)
~~~

Note that the `tip` is a symlink to the highest version, in this case `2`.

You can test this using the command line tool like this for example:

~~~
ign fuel download -v 4 --force-version 1.1.0 -u "https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/chapulina/models/Test box"
~~~

Note that when downloading the tip, the version will be hardcoded to 1 until [this PR](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuelserver/pull-requests/135/return-x-ign-resource-version-header-in/diff) is deployed on the backend.
update.title: Cache model versions side-by-side

content.raw: Let’s treat windows the same as we do linux and mac.
content.html: Let’s treat windows the same as we do linux and mac.

content.raw: There's an interesting [issue on ign-common](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/issues/21/the-use-of-symlinks-on-windows-is-dubious) explaining that symlinks on Windows are trickier than it seems. If we're really worried about Windows right now I think it may be best not to use sym links.
content.html: There's an interesting issue on ign-common explaining that symlinks on Windows are trickier than it seems. If we're really worried about Windows right now I think it may be best not to use sym links.

content.raw:
Looks like there is a windows function for symlinks:[https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363866\(v=vs.85\).aspx](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363866(v=vs.85).aspx)

Can you add that in to this PR?
content.html:
Looks like there is a windows function for symlinks:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363866(v=vs.85).aspx

Can you add that in to this PR?

content.raw: I suspect this is not the only thing in fuel-tools not working on Windows, but I think we can drop the symlink if there's no way it could ever work on Windows, and add logic which finds the highest version.
content.html: I suspect this is not the only thing in fuel-tools not working on Windows, but I think we can drop the symlink if there's no way it could ever work on Windows, and add logic which finds the highest version.

content.raw:
This code doesn’t support symlinks on windows, which I think would make fuel-tools not work properly. 

Since the symlink always should point to the highest number, can we drop the “tip” symlink all together and just use the highest numbered version?
content.html:
This code doesn’t support symlinks on windows, which I think would make fuel-tools not work properly.

Since the symlink always should point to the highest number, can we drop the “tip” symlink all together and just use the highest numbered version?
